title: Lads trick pal into attending Premier League Darts as the only one dressed as a blue Smurf

A group of lads have tricked one of their pals to turn up at the Premier League Darts as the only person dressed as a Smurf. 
Worse still, Darren Buckley, 27 decided to go as Smurfette, a female Smurf. 
The footage was posted online by Brody Walmsley, 26, and begins with him and Bradley Mills, 25, on his way to pick up the unsuspecting Darren. 
Darren is first spotted in the video waving his arms in the air to flag down Brody but his joy soon turns to embarrassment when he realises his two friends are not in fancy dress. The lads prepare for their big surprise in the car (Photo: Brody Walmsley/Guzelian) The blue Smurf is spotted (Photo: Brody Walmsley/Guzelian) The blue Smurfette from the car (Photo: Brody Walmsley/Guzelian) 
The video, which was only posted yesterday, has been viewed nearly 400,000 times on Facebook with over 4,500 shares. 
Brody posted the video on Facebook and said: "Watch this video please. 
"We are going out tonight and have told Darren for two weeks that we are going in fancy dress. He's only gone and fell for it hahahaha." 
To make the situation just a little bit more awkward, Darren had decided to go as Smurfette, a female Smurf. 
Darren can be seen trying to cover his face with the hair from his blonde locks as the blue paint covers his undoubtedly red face. Darren's blue hue comes into focus from the car (Photo: Brody Walmsley/Guzelian) Darren in the blue paint (Photo: Brody Walmsley/Guzelian) Darren gets in the car and wanted to go home to get changed (Photo: Brody Walmsley/Guzelian) Read More Beauty queen can barely hide her rage after she's voted out of Miss Colombia competition 
Luckily, the three Bolton lads were on their way to watch the PDC Premier League Darts event at the Manchester arena, where is common for people to wear fancy dress. 
Brody confirmed Darren's immediate reaction was a request to take him home to change but they ended up driving straight to the arena. 
Brody added: "He asked us to take him home to get changed. I was shocked in all honesty. I didn't think the video would get this much attention. Darren enjoying the darts at Manchester Arena (Photo: Brody Walmsley/Guzelian) Darren enjoying the darts at Manchester Arena (Photo: Brody Walmsley/Guzelian) Read More Metro installs men-only 'sexist seats' featuring a 'PENIS' as part of sexual harassment campaign 
It was just a joke between friends and it seems everyone else seems to find it funny. 
"Smurfs was the plan just because of the body paint being irreversible, anything else he could of got changed out of. 
"He's is gullible yes but he was sold on the idea and really wanted to do it so there wasn't much persuasion." Like us on Facebook
